intro: Achyrocline rufescens, commonly known as the red-stemmed false geranium, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in dry, open habitats. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences. Achyrocline rufescens is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for various purposes.
